messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Harry Potter/ was going to school/commercials
messages.msgSnippet: two questions: To appreciate the game do you have to know the books/characters? (cuz we don t yet) and Does anyone have 5/6 yr olds that enjoy hearing the
messages.messageBody:
two questions:
To appreciate the game do you have to know the
books/characters? (cuz we don't yet)
and
Does anyone have 5/6 yr olds that enjoy hearing the
Harry Potter books read?
(I make up such stories of my own for him all the
time, but the wording and what not is what I'm
wondering about. comprehensive for him?)


--- Sandi & Scott Spaeth <vespass@...> wrote:
> At 07:05 AM 2/8/01 -0800, you wrote:
> >There is a Harry Potter Uno-Style game out now.
> It's called Harry Potter
> >Uno. Haven't checked it out, bc we have Uno
> already and enjoy it. Saw
> >it at Fred Meyers, in kid's games, for about $5.
> >Mary Ellen
> >Gain weight... Stay Active... Get Smarter...
> >New Year's Resolutions are EASY for Babies!
> ><Hi and Lois>
>
>
> We have it, the cards are really nice. It has a few
> different cards that
> make the game a bit more unique, but basically the
> play is still the same.
>
> Sandi
>
> PS they also have family puzzles out with large and
> small pieces that are
> Harry Potter themed too.
>
--------------------------------------------------------------
>
> Take no heroes,
> Only inspiration.
>
> Piston Ported Vespas:
> http://www.piston-ported.hompage.com/index.html
> words

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Harry Potter/ was going to school/commercials
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/8/01 7:42:25 AM Pacific Standard Time, vespass@swbell.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/8/01 7:42:25 AM Pacific Standard Time,
vespass@... writes:

<< PS they also have family puzzles out with large and small pieces that are
Harry Potter themed too >>

My daughter got one of these for Christmas, and it was really fun, except my
side was too **hard**. :-( I was still working way after she was done,
although she and her friend were kind enough to help me.

candice

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Harry Potter/ was going to school/commercials
messages.msgSnippet: ... We have it, the cards are really nice.  It has a few different cards that make the game a bit more unique, but basically the play is still the same. Sandi
messages.messageBody:
At 07:05 AM 2/8/01 -0800, you wrote:
>There is a Harry Potter Uno-Style game out now. It's called Harry Potter
>Uno. Haven't checked it out, bc we have Uno already and enjoy it. Saw
>it at Fred Meyers, in kid's games, for about $5.
>Mary Ellen
>Gain weight... Stay Active... Get Smarter...
>New Year's Resolutions are EASY for Babies!
><Hi and Lois>


We have it, the cards are really nice. It has a few different cards that
make the game a bit more unique, but basically the play is still the same.

Sandi

PS they also have family puzzles out with large and small pieces that are
Harry Potter themed too.
--------------------------------------------------------------

Take no heroes,
Only inspiration.

http://www.piston-ported.hompage.com/index.html

messages.subject: Re: Harry Potter/ was going to school/commercials
messages.msgSnippet: There is a Harry Potter Uno-Style game out now.  It s called Harry Potter Uno.  Haven t checked it out, bc we have Uno already and enjoy it.  Saw it at Fred
messages.messageBody:
There is a Harry Potter Uno-Style game out now. It's called Harry Potter
Uno. Haven't checked it out, bc we have Uno already and enjoy it. Saw
it at Fred Meyers, in kid's games, for about $5.
Mary Ellen
Gain weight... Stay Active... Get Smarter...
New Year's Resolutions are EASY for Babies!
<Hi and Lois>
